meanings.def: to ask God to protect somebody/something
examples: They brought the children to Jesus and he blessed them.

meanings.def: to make something holy by saying a prayer over it
examples: The priest blessed the bread and wine.

meanings.def: to call God holy; to praise God
examples: We bless your holy name, O Lord.
Bless my soul! Here comes Bill!
‘Where's Joe?’ ‘I'm blessed if I know!’ (= I don't know)

meanings.def: to have something good such as ability, great happiness, etc.
examples: We're blessed with five lovely grandchildren.

meanings.def: said to somebody after they have sneezed
used to show that you are pleased with somebody, especially because of something they have done
examples: Sarah, bless her, had made a cup of tea.

meanings.def: used when you are leaving somebody, to say that you hope they will be safe, etc.

meanings.def: used to show warm feelings for somebody because of something they have done
examples: ‘He bought us all a present.’ ‘Oh, bless!’
